text: WASP-29 is an orange main sequence star in the constellation of Phoenix. == Star characteristics == The star kinematically belongs to the thin disk of the Milky Way. == Planetary system == The "Hot Saturn" class planet WASP-29b was discovered around WASP-29 in 2010. The planet would have an equilibrium temperature of 980 K. The planetary atmosphere has abundant carbon monoxide but likely lacks methaneMatthew Hardin, Joseph Harrington, K. Stevenson, "WASP-29b: Another Cool Exoplanet With Abundant CO?" and sodium.A Gemini ground-based transmission spectrum of WASP-29b: a featureless spectrum from 515 to 720 nm Study in 2018 have revealed the stability of planetary orbits in the habitable zone of WASP-29 is significantly affected by the WASP-29b planet.Nikolaos Georgakarakos, Siegfried Eggl, and Ian Dobbs-Dixon1Giant, "Planets: Good Neighbors for Habitable Worlds?", 2018 == References == Category:Planetary systems with one confirmed planet Category:Phoenix (constellation) Category:K-type main-sequence stars Category:Planetary transit variables J23513108-3954241 29
title: WASP-29
